column4: hello, I have a short question, I just want to check... I bought the external disk od 500G. I need to use it for windows and linux both. can it be formated to fat32?
yes, but single file size will be limited to 2gb; although linux with ntfs-3g can write to ntfs
if you mount ntfs using the utility ntfs-3g, there isn't a problem
your local user needs permissions to access the drive; aside from mounting it as well
so that just leaves changing the permissions then
how do I give those permissions?
look into chown or chmod; google and the fourms should yield good results
using TestDisk it gives me dr-xr-xr-x     0     0         0 24-Feb-2008 17:01  for that disk
have you checked your /etc/mtab or /fstab?
can you see the files but not write to the disk?
esto era un disco vacio. lo habia formateado a FAT32 despues me acaban de cambiar de opinion y lo acabo de formatear a NTFS otra vez y ahora no lo puedo usar
